    • Method Detail

      • type

        public static java.lang.String type(int cvType)
        Displays an openCV pixel type from a Mat object in a human readable format. Gray images are 1-dimensional unsigned 8bit Color images are 3-dimensional unsigned 8bit
        Parameters:
        cvType - opencv formatted type
        Returns:
        human readable opencv type

      • matrix

        public static java.lang.String matrix(org.opencv.core.Mat m)

      • pixel

        public static java.lang.String pixel(byte blue,
                                     byte green,
                                     byte red)
        Displays a BGR openCV color pixel in a human readable format As a note, the openCV Mat object stores its pixels in a 1-D byte array. The channels for each pixel are presented in blue-green-red ordering.
        Parameters:
        blue - blue channel of pixel
        green - green channel of pixel
        red - red channel of pixel
        Returns:
        a string triplet of the pixel channels
        See Also:
        colorByte(byte)

      • colorByte

        public static int colorByte(byte colorValue)
        Returns the color value byte of an openCV Mat as an integer in [0, 256). The pixel color channels of 8bit images loop such that: 0 is black 127 is midgrey -128 is midgray + 1 -1 is white This method returns them in the familiar format as usually found in image processing application.
        Parameters:
        colorValue - openCV color channel
        Returns:
        color channel in the familiar format
        See Also:
        pixel(byte, byte, byte)
